For Peter Crouch , apparently not even a thrilling penalty shootout in the biggest game of the European club calender can tear him away from Britain's Next Top Model. 
And not just because his wife Abbey Clancy is a star of the show. 
The model and Top Model judge claimed on BB1 that the Stoke striker missed last year's Champions League final to see Chloe Keenan crowned the show's latest winner. 
"Pete loves it," said Clancy told Nick Grimshaw on the BBC Radio 1 Breakfast Show. Abbey Clancy dobbed in husband Peter Crouch (Photo: Getty Images) 
"I know he missed the Champions League final or whatever it was last year to watch the final of Top Model. 
"I was like Pete, you’ve got to watch the final, you’ve watched the whole series." 
Now there's a problem with this claim, and it's not Crouch's taste in entertainment. This is the guy famed for his brilliant robot celebration, after all. Abbey Clancy's career kick-started when she was runner-up in the second season of Britain's Next Top Model in 2006 (Photo: WENN.com) Clancy is a judge on the show with Paul Sculfor, Hilary Alexander and Nicky Johnston (Photo: WENN.com) Read More Potterer releases HUGE Peter Crouch mugs to celebrate striker's 100 Premier League goals 
It's that when the finale of the last season of Top Model aired on March 17, Real Madrid and Atletico Madrid were far from reaching the Champions League final, which was on May 28 and ended with Cristiano Ronaldo slotting the winning spot kick. 
But Crouchy hardly mounted a defence against his wife of six years, sheepishly tweeting in response of the chat: "TMI Abigail." Chloe Keenan on a photoshoot for Britain's Next Top Model before she won last series 
Clancy made her name on Top Model when she was runner-up in the second series in 2006 and has been a judge since last year. 
She recently attended the launch for the 2017 season. Like us on Facebook
